item.title: Random need help
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:13, topic:394367”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=491551.msg3594745#msg3594745 date=1304970431]

iknow but how to use a case in another case ?

Why do you want a case inside a case?
[/quote]wouldn’t that give a compiler error…[/quote]

Yes.

The closest thing you can get to a case within a case is a switch statement inside a case, or a case fall through.

			case 327:

{
if (Misc.random(playerLevel[playerFishing] + 5) >= 10) {
success = true;
exp = 40;
}
}

if (playerLevel[10] >= 10)
{
int chance = (int) (Math.random() * 100) + 1;
if (chance > 40) { // 60% chance for sardine

    } else { // 40% chance for herring.
	if (chance < 40) {
	case 345:
	success = true;
	exp = 60;
	break;
	
    }

}
}
break;

Read full topic

item.title: Random need help
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Yorchi elite, post:7, topic:394367”]thats the fishing spot.

btw now i only fish Sardine, and i did not change the code.[/quote]

Are you sure you’re just very “unlucky”? I tested this code

int count = Integer.MAX_VALUE;
double sardines = 0.0;
double herring = 0.0;
for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
	int chance = (int) (Math.random() * 100) + 1;
	if (chance > 40) { // 60% chance for sardine.
		sardines++;
	}
	else { // 40% chance for herring.
		herring++;
	}
}
System.out.println(sardines / count + ", " + herring / count);

And concluded that the chance of catching a sardine is 59.995624%, and the chance of getting a herring is 40.004376%

EDIT: Also, replace the

new java.util.Random().nextInt(100) + 1

with

(int) (Math.random() * 100) + 1

Exponentially sped up the process.

Read full topic
